224f6473-4a7f-4bd8-bce0-16dbc6993444.description: Students in this course will build knowledge of key events and figures in the history of the United States from American prehistory through the era of Reconstruction. Students will learn how to think like a historian and apply a historian's lens to real-world situations.

4b57a9e6-7d71-42ff-b2a3-e5b9facaee76.description: With every dollar you spend, save, or invest, you deserve to know that you are making the best financial decisions in today's economy. Knowing what drives the economy can help you understand all aspects of life, including jobs, income, consumer prices, trade, and overall prosperity. In this course, you will explore key concepts of economics and personal finance. You will learn how to reason with an economic mindset, use tools for financial analysis, and develop skills to plan for your future.

Students deepen their knowledge of four essential skills -- problem solving, technology, agility, & communication -- to analyze the past, forecast the future, adapt to changes, and share their understanding. Students analyze historical resources, and use critical thinking to determine causes and long term impacts of a historical event.

Students will compose written communication with appropriate tone and language, and deliver an oral presentation to engage an audience.
b0b1478c-d4c4-4dd2-82f1-1c8df01c7cc9.name: Business Communication (BUSI1025)

This course is designed to introduce learners to 10 key employability skills that will help them navigate the world of work and the uncertainties it can bring. Data shows the value of applying these 10 skills. In this social science course, students will learn how to assess, define, and amplify these 10 career skills.

becdf587-c30f-4264-bc45-601427be5bd2.description: Students in the course will be introduced to the basics of computer programming from data types, to creating classes, to algorithms and testing. Students will learn these concepts while diving deep into the syntax of Java as the core programming language. The course culminates in the opportunity for students to design and build a project that answers a need or goal they identify.
becdf587-c30f-4264-bc45-601427be5bd2.name: Introduction to Java Programming (CS1101)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, and project-based assignments with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, case studies, computer-based training, lecture, and practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

af47ecb0-6b90-42e5-b8d9-6d96b7403840.description: This course focuses on the research process. Students will learn how to effectively source information using proper research techniques, beginning by crafting a research question and culminating in a 6-8 page persuasive essay that will influence others to adopt or change a particular perspective. Students will also explore how persuasive writing strengthens important professional skills including communication, problem solving, and innovation skills.
af47ecb0-6b90-42e5-b8d9-6d96b7403840.name: Workplace Writing II (ENG1020)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, computer-based training, lecture, and practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

ed7e6dba-7c53-4c39-bc45-59ac568ef78b.description: The Sophia Ambassador Program is for current students and alumni of Sophia. These learners have expressed that Sophia has provided great benefits for their learning journey and lives. Potential ambassadors complete an application and are admitted based on adherence to our brand standards. Once accepted, Ambassadors have the opportunity to participate in monthly development meetings, engage and network in a Slack community, promote Sophia, and refer friends with discount codes, among other perks.
ed7e6dba-7c53-4c39-bc45-59ac568ef78b.name: 2022 Sophia Learning Ambassador

badge_template_activities.title: Members were accepted into the 2022 Sophia Ambassador Program.

d680c363-5fe5-4205-91a1-3aa55ac9af56.description: Altering a recipe, planning road trips, getting the best deal when shopping, and financing college— what do all these things have in common? An understanding of numbers and how to use and interpret them. In the workplace, fields such as business, technology, and criminal justice all depend on math. You will learn how to apply mathematics to positively inform your world. Learn how to use straightforward approaches for fundamental math and algebra to create meaning and see the world in a new way.
d680c363-5fe5-4205-91a1-3aa55ac9af56.name: Introductory Applied Math (MATH1001)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, computer-based training, lecture, and practical exercises.
The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

cb388951-3649-414c-9613-94cc4f97a459.description: This course introduces learners to the fundamental steps to secure a job role. Learners will gain an understanding of the job search process and what it takes to prepare a resume and cover letter. Learners will also learn how to use their relevant experiences to succeed in interviews along with understanding how to act professionally in the workplace. Finally, learners will have the opportunity to create their own resume and cover letter, along with putting their interview skills to the test.
cb388951-3649-414c-9613-94cc4f97a459.name: Introduction to Career Readiness (CRED1001)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers and quizzes, with a minimum passing score of 70%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, computer-based training, project-based instruction, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

4ee092cf-5146-4233-9cfc-a3898f4c721d.description: Students in this course move through the writing process, from brainstorming, prewriting, and drafting all the way to revising, editing, and proofreading. Students will have an opportunity to develop their written voice in both informative and persuasive contexts, drawing connections between the principles of academic writing and their application in a professional context.
4ee092cf-5146-4233-9cfc-a3898f4c721d.name: Workplace Writing I (ENG1010)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, computer-based training, lecture, and practical exercises.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit¬†www.acenet.edu.

10e1222e-959f-44d1-b9aa-ce1774f39c36.description: Students in this course learn foundational writing skills that will enable them to be successful in a college-level English Composition course. Students will learn how to construct sound sentences, craft effective paragraphs, and write cohesive compositions, developing their writing skills through all stages of the writing process. Students will learn how to avoid common grammatical errors as well as how to identify these errors in their writing.
10e1222e-959f-44d1-b9aa-ce1774f39c36.name: Foundations of English Composition (ENG0050)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, examinations, and project-based assignments with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

1773e561-f7fa-42d1-bd36-54ddef67210d.description: Students in this course will prepare for the skills needed for Calculus I. In this course, students will build off the topics in Sophia’s College Algebra by evaluating and graphing functions, and solving systems of equations using matrices. Students will then investigate different types of functions by graphing power, polynomial, and rational functions. By solving exponential and logarithmic equations, students will also model real-world situations.
1773e561-f7fa-42d1-bd36-54ddef67210d.name: Precalculus (MATH1035)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.

ea9534aa-e198-4f46-b63d-1482b1eec532.description: This course introduces 10 key employability skills that will help them navigate the world of work its uncertainties. Data shows that applying these 10 skills is vital to career growth and professional success. Students will learn how to assess, define, and amplify the 10 skills throughout their life and career, while exploring the job search process, discovering what it takes to prepare for an interview, and establishing a powerful presence to strengthen their professional and personal success.
ea9534aa-e198-4f46-b63d-1482b1eec532.name: Career Readiness (CRED1010)

0dbd8c90-5d45-4f09-af0a-8e88858d7fdb.description: This course is designed to be used with the accompanying lecture course, creating a robust investigation and journey into the natural sciences. It’s recommended that students complete this Human Biology Lab course simultaneously with Human Biology, so they fully experience the application and real-world relevance of the subject. In this lab course, students will apply the scientific method, explore phenomena, and exercise critical thinking skills using virtual lab simulations from Labster.
0dbd8c90-5d45-4f09-af0a-8e88858d7fdb.name: Human Biology Lab (SCIE1021)

skills.name: Molecular and Cellular Basis of Life

c169a27e-d420-4f4a-b59c-8e7fc465e909.description: This course introduces more complex verb tenses and grammatical structures as a continuation of Spanish I. Students will build on their Spanish speaking, reading, and writing skills through both a linguistic and cultural lens, exploring the cultures and customs of several Spanish-speaking countries along with new vocabulary and sentence constructions for discussing home and work routines, travel and recreation, and events that have happened in both the recent and more distant past.
c169a27e-d420-4f4a-b59c-8e7fc465e909.name: Spanish II (SPAN1002)

In this course, students will apply the scientific method, explore phenomena, and exercise critical thinking skills using virtual lab simulations.
be049a80-c455-4f9e-a447-d1f97c27b1dc.name: Introduction to Chemistry Lab (CHEM1002)

564aaf6c-2055-4feb-8787-38fa2a664a50.description: Students in this course will develop an understanding of the scientific principles and processes that shape our environment, as well as the impact of human activities; apply knowledge of a wide range of environmental issues in context, including limitations on natural resources, endangered species, pollution, and climate change; and engage with these issues by analyzing current policies and efforts relating to environmental issues, as well as possible future solutions.
564aaf6c-2055-4feb-8787-38fa2a664a50.name: Environmental Science (ENVS1001 - 2015)

2878000f-868b-4e63-9914-4bc94a490cee.description: The course objective is to familiarize with the basic principles of psychology and the scientific methods. Students study a variety of topics including the brain, learning and memory, personality, social influence, child and lifespan development, and psychopathology. Students will demonstrate the application of these psychology topics to everyday situations.
2878000f-868b-4e63-9914-4bc94a490cee.name: Introduction to Psychology (PSY1001 - 2013)

badge_template_activities.title: In order to be awarded a Sophia Ambassador Credly badge, accepted applicants into the program must engage in 2 challenges per month for at least 1 quarter out of the calendar year. Challenges include but are not limited to the following: Posting content on social media Responding to questions on social forumsPosting a review of Sophia or a specific course Participating in user testing or market research of the Sophia product (e.g. providing feedback on a new feature)
